sentences.en: A fountain of helium spurt out of the tube.
sentences.cn: 有一股氦的喷泉从小管中喷出.

sentences.en: A great spurt of blood came out of the wound.
A spurt of diesel came from one valve and none from the other.
sentences.cn: 一股股柴油从一个阀门喷涌而出，但另一个没有。

sentences.en: After a silence, Molly let her anger spurt out.
sentences.cn: 沉默了一会儿, 莫莉的怒气便迸发了出来.

sentences.en: At adolescence, muscles go through a growth spurt.
sentences.cn: 在青春期，肌肉会迅猛发育。

sentences.en: Green put on a spurt and gained upon his pursuer.
sentences.cn: 格林一鼓作气把追赶的人抛在后面.

sentences.en: Harris went on with a small spurt of energy.
sentences.cn: 哈里斯又来了一股劲,继续谈下去.

sentences.en: He hit her on the head, causing her too to spurt blood.
sentences.cn: 他击中了她的头部，她也开始流血。

sentences.en: He put in a spurt at the beginning of the eighth lap.
sentences.cn: 他进入第八圈时便开始冲刺.

sentences.en: I flushed bright red as a spurt of anger flashed through me.
sentences.cn: 一股怒气直冲头顶，我的脸一下子涨得通红。

sentences.en: I put on a spurt and soon caught them up.
sentences.cn: 我一猛劲儿,很快就追上了他们.

sentences.en: I saw flames spurt from the roof.
sentences.cn: 我看到火焰从屋顶冒了出来。

sentences.en: Put on a spurt, or you'll fall behind.
sentences.cn: 加把劲, 不然你要落后了.

sentences.en: The recent spurt in violence has demoralised the public.
sentences.cn: 最近暴力行为激增，这已经打击了公众的信心。

sentences.en: The water came out with a spurt.

phrases.tran_cn: 生长陡增；生长突增；（经济）急剧增长

trans.tran_cn: （怒气，精力等的）迸发，突然喷出
trans.tran_en: when an amount of liquid or flame suddenly comes quickly out of something
